RECORD.TEXT: 057594022 DH 1859819 724509 515882 7/12/2001 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary Signed DIS Report Status : Signed DISCHARGE SUMMARY NAME : BLEICHYORKSCRUP , RYLA A UNIT NUMBER : 724-42-43 ADMISSION DATE : 07/12/2001 DISCHARGE DATE : 07/17/2001 DATE OF ADMISSION : 7/12/01 DATE OF DISCHARGE : 7/17/01 DOB : 05/23/79 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : Choledocholithiasis . PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : Laparoscopic cholecystectomy . ASSOCIATED PROCEDURES : ERCP . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient is a 22 year-old woman previously healthy who presented to our ED who presented with three week history of intermittent right upper quadrant pain . As the patient 's symptoms were worsening , she brought herself to the ED . She denies any nausea and vomiting or diarrhea . The pain localizes to the right upper quadrant and seems to radiate to the back . There are no associated fevers or chills . There is no dysuria . There is no CVA tenderness . Her last menstrual period was three weeks ago . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : None . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY : None . MEDICATIONS : None . SOCIAL HISTORY : No smoking , no alcohol . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : The patient was in no acute distress . Temperature was 98 degrees . Heart rate was 92 . Blood pressure was 122/81 . Cardiac was regular rate and rhythm . Lungs were clear to auscultation bilaterally . Abdomen had positive bowel sounds , was soft . There was right upper quadrant tenderness , no guarding and no rebound . Extremities warm with no edema . LABS : Sodium 137 , potassium 3.7 , chloride 104 , CO2 27.9 . BUN 13 , creatinine .6 . White count was 10.3 , hematocrit of 38.8 . Platelets were 343 . Coags were within normal limits . HCG was negative . LFTs T-bili .3 , direct bili .2 . Alk / phos 75 . SGOT 72 . SGPT 180 . Amylase 102 , lipase 2.8 . Ultrasound of the right upper quadrant was negative sonographic Murphy 's sign , positive cholelithiasis , positive choledocholithiasis ( 1.5 cm stone in the common bile duct ) . No gallbladder wall thickening and positive intrahepatic ductal dilatation . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was admitted . She was made NPO . She received Unasyn for prophylaxis against cholangitis . On 7/12/01 the patient underwent ERCP . Cholangiogram showed multiple large stones in the common bile duct and common hepatic duct as well as the gallbladder . She underwent endoscopic sphincterotomy then , with removal of multiple and numerous common bile duct and common hepatic duct stones ( greater than 40 ) . There were apparently no large stones seen to be remaining in the duct . Post ERCP , the patient was still kept on antibiotics . Her amylase and lipase slightly increased to 138 and 2 respectively . She did not have any fevers , nor did her white count change . She was allowed to eat on hospital day #2 after ERCP and tolerated this well . LFTs were followed . There was no acute change in her bilirubin or alkaline phosphatase . On 7/16/01 the patient was taken to the operating room and a laparoscopic cholecystectomy was performed . At that operation a slightly edematous gallbladder was found as well as a dilated cystic duct . This gallbladder was removed without complications . The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred back to the floor in stable condition . The patient was discharged to home on postoperative day #1 . Her pain was well controlled with Percocet . She was tolerating PO intake . CONDITION ON DISCHARGE : Stable . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE : Percocet one to two tablets PO q 4 hours prn and Colace 100 mgs PO tid . FOLLOW UP : In the General Surgery Clinic in two weeks . SONLE BE , M.D. DICTATING FOR : NONOK F. BE , M.D. TR : vl DD : 07/20/2001 TD : 07/22/2001 1:28 P cc : SONLE BE , M.D. CLECAR DRIPPS , M.D. NONOK F. BE , M.D. [ report_end ]
